alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:11PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LOS ALAMOS, SOUTHEASTERN RIO ARRIBA, EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL AND NORTHWESTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 410 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bandelier National Monument, or near Los Alamos, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Los Alamos, Espanola, White Rock, Pojoaque, Santa Clara Pueblo, Nambe Pueblo, Frijoles, Bandelier National Monument, Pojoaque Pueblo and Cuyamungue. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area
